thread.title: Storm chasers honour Twister star Bill Paxton by writing his initials across Tornado Alley using GPS markers
thread.title_full: Storm chasers honour Twister star Bill Paxton by writing his initials across Tornado Alley using GPS markers

author: Chris kitching
title: Storm chasers honour Twister star Bill Paxton by writing his initials across Tornado Alley using GPS markers
text:
News Storm chasers honour Twister star Bill Paxton by writing his initials across Tornado Alley using GPS markers Paxton, 61, gave the dangerous profession global fame after he and co-star Helen Hunt appeared in the 1996 film as a pair of tornado hunters Share Bill Paxton and Helen Hunt in a scene from Twister (Photo: Rex Features) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Storm chasers have found a unique way to pay tribute to late actor Bill Paxton , who made their dangerous profession famous in the film Twister. 
Hundreds of chasers used their Spotter Network GPS markers to spell out Paxton's initials across Tornado Alley in the US. 
Radar showed the initials "BP" across a wide area covering parts of Kansas, Oklahoma and northern Texas. 
Twister, also starring Helen Hunt, was a massive hit after it was released in cinemas in 1996, with Paxton playing the role of a storm chaser in pursuit of a devastating F5 tornado . Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
